data.title: Orders for Apple's iPhone SE better than expected, but iPhone shipments to drop 20-25% this quarter, top analyst says
data.text: Phone shipments in the quarter ending in June could decline 20% or 25% year-over-year because of reduced demand stemming from the Covid-19 coronavirus pandemic, top analyst predicts.

data.title: Apple plans to crank out more iPhones despite sagging demand: report

data.title: Apple plans 4% boost in iPhone output through March but some suppliers are skeptical: report
data.text: Apple Inc. AAPL, -2.07% is looking to manufacture roughly 213 million iPhones through March 2021, which would boost its production by 4% from the prior-year period, according to a report from the Nikkei Asian Review.
